verbose_text: The high tannin concentration of L. cuneata litter has been shown to slow down the litter decomposition rate, as well as the release rates of N, P, K, Mg, and other trace elements, and soils in L. cuneata dominated old fields have been found to have lower soil enzyme activity in comparison to stands dominated by the perennial grass Festuca pratensis.
evidence: tannin concentration of L. cuneata litter has been shown to slow down the litter decomposition rate, as well as the release rates of N, P, K, Mg
